title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley jokes about the 'lurgy' which is rife on the show
text:
Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley joked about the 'lurgy' which is jeopardising the show's live programme during her appearance on Thursday's Loose Women.

During her appearance, panellist Nadia Sawalha wore a mask over her face in order to protect herself against the sickness which is apparently rife on the Strictly set.

After previously saying she'd tried to dodge the illness, Catherine said: 'We're alright, we've overcome it babes we've had it we've got loads of vitamin C we're fine.'

Addressing it: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley joked about the 'lurgy' which is jeopardising the show's live programme during her appearance on Thursday's Loose Women

Catherine was interviewed on the show alongside her professional dance partner Johannes Radebe, where she discussed her growing confidence since joining the hit BBC dance show.

Speaking about her experience, she said: 'I've literally never danced before and in the past I've been told I can’t dance or I was too big to dance, I remember this dance teacher going you look like an Oompa Loompa there.'

Insisting that her dance partner was behind her transformation, she said: 'Johannes has given me so much confidence...

Partners: Catherine was interviewed on the show alongside her professional dance partner Johannes Radebe, where she discussed her growing confidence since joining the show

'This man has changed my life and he's a huge part of why I'm loving it so much. I was scared of doing a forward roll and suddenly we're doing acrobatics.'

Johannes was quick to complement her progress, and said: 'You be yourself and look at somebody and you recognise their potential when I saw Cath she was fantastic.

He added: 'She can adapt to anything I throw at her and she doesn't complain. I've got a good student so I can do anything and be anything.'

Johannes also touched on his group routine from last Saturday's show where he performed wearing a pair of black heels, he said: 'I've tried on a pair of heels before, thought they didn't fit me I still put my feet in them.

'It was honestly lovely to just, I don't know how many times I've watched it back. I thought it was fabulous and for the opportunity to dance in heels and come to work wearing heels it was incredible.'

Comparing the British and South African versions of the show, he said: 'The British people have got more munch, munch means money...

'The production here is incredible, the British Strictly is the mothership it's beautiful to be a part of this one. We do it on a very small scale.'

A source told The Daily Star on Thursday that several stars have been hit by the bug which has spread quickly behind the scenes, with Catherine admitting she's determined she's been trying to dodge 'the lurgy.'

She said: 'The lurgy has been doing the rounds at Strictly for weeks. It's been trying to get me but it won't win!'

It comes after head judge Shirley Ballas took to Instagram last week to reveal that she had put herself on a vitamin trip, after a 'tough' week left her feeling 'under the weather.'

A source said: 'When someone gets sick it quickly spreads through the cast. Lots of people have been under the weather but the show must go on.'

The publication also said the producers have stocked up on medicine for sick cast members and have encouraged everyone to sanitise their hands regularly.

A representative for Strictly Come Dancing declined to comment when contacted by MailOnline.
